docs.text: A Cohen ring $C$, over a field $k$, is a complete local Noetherian commutative ring with maximal ideal $pC$, where $p = \mathrm{char}(C)$. Examples ¶ Witt vectors over any perfect field $k$ Properties ¶ Teichmüller's embedding process Cohen's homomorphism theorem Mac Lane's identity theorem

docs.text: A difference field is a pair $(k,\sigma)$ where $k$ is a field and $\sigma: k \to k$ is a field automorphism. Examples ¶ Lift of the Frobenius on Witt vectors Lift to Hahn series of any residue automorphism
docs.title: Difference field

docs.text: Lift of the Frobenius on Witt vectors Lift to Hahn series of any residue automorphism

docs.title: Lift of the Frobenius

docs.text: Given a field $k$ and an automorphism $\bar\sigma$ of $k$, there is a lift of $\bar\sigma$ to any field of Hahn series $k((\Gamma))$ given by $$\sigma(\sum a_\gamma t^\gamma) = \sum \bar\sigma(a_\gamma) t^\gamma.$$
docs.title: Lift to Hahn series
